thread.title: Celtic legend Tommy Gemmell makes final journey past Parkhead as hundreds turn out for his funeral
thread.title_full: Celtic legend Tommy Gemmell makes final journey past Parkhead as hundreds turn out for his funeral

author: mirror
title: Celtic legend Tommy Gemmell makes final journey past Parkhead as hundreds turn out for his funeral
text:
Celtic legend Tommy Gemmell makes final journey past Parkhead as hundreds turn out for his funeral The member of the Lisbon Lions side passed away earlier this month aged 73 Share The Celtic legend has been laid to rest (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Tommy Gemmell made a poignant final journey past Parkhead as hundreds of fans turned out to pay their last respects to the Celtic giant, one of the Lisbon Lions. 
The former Scotland left-back died at the age of 73 after a long illness, Celtic announced last week. 
His funeral is being held at Daldowie Crematorium in Uddingston, South Lanarkshire. 
Ahead of the service, fans lined the entrance to the Celtic Park ground as the funeral cortege made its way past, allowing them to say their final farewells to the club legend. Tributes were left outside the ground (Photo: PA) Willie Henderson of Rangers and Bobby Leenox of Celtic help carry the funeral (Photo: DAILY RECORD) Read More Tommy Gemmell dead: Celtic Lisbon Lion legend passes away after long illness 
Applause rang out as the procession left the Parkhead stadium in the east end of Glasgow for the final time while a number of supporters threw Celtic scarves towards the funeral cars. 
A wreath of white flowers beside the coffin bore the emblem of the Lisbon Lions - the Celtic team whose victory over Inter Milan in the Portuguese capital in 1967 saw them become the first British club to win the European Cup. The order of service (Photo: DAILY RECORD) Floral tributes were on display (Photo: PA) 
In a statement released when he died Celtic said: "The whole Celtic Family is mourning his passing, and everyone associated with the club sends their thoughts and prayers to his family, his fellow Lions and his many friends at this desperately sad time. Gemmell was a club legend (Photo: Daily Record) 
"Tommy Gemmell is a true Celtic legend, part of the greatest side in the club's history and a man who played a pivotal role in our greatest ever triumph when, in Lisbon's Estadio Nacional, 11 men all born within a 30-mile radius of Celtic Park, beat Inter Milan to win the European Cup. 
"The legend of the Lisbon Lions was created that night, and Tommy and his team-mates were assured their place in the pantheon of Celtic greats." poll loading Will Celtic win the Scottish title by 40 or more points? 500+ VOTES SO FAR
